examples: The door was stuck shut so Tomi had to grip the door knob and pull hard to open the door.

images.alt: Photo of worker holding tightly to a metal bar.
images.description: In the foreground, a person uses two hands to hold a long silver metal bar, which is attached to a large round metal object. Opposite to the person in the foreground, another person holds a long orange bar, also attached to the large round metal object. In the background are three more people and four tall tanks labeled: Oxygen.
images.caption: A worker grips a metal bar with two hands.

source.title: Machinist's Mate Fireman tightens his grip
source.author: U.S. Navy photo by Photographer's Mate 3rd Class Kitt Amaritnant

meanings.definition: any animal that hunts other animals for food.
examples: Mice try to avoid being caught by predators that will catch and eat them.

images.alt: Photo of a cheetah hunting prey.
images.description: Photo shows a small gazelle running from right to left. A short distance behind the gazelle is a large cheetah, a light brown animal with dark brown spots. The cheetah is leaping toard the small gazelle.
images.caption: The cheetah, a type of large cat, is a predator and hunts other animals.

examples: The crowd watched in amazement as the magician performed his tricks.

images.alt: Photo of a child with wide open eyes and mouth.
images.description: A child looking directly at the viewer. Her expression is happy. Her mouth and eyes are wide open.
images.caption: If you are surprised by something good or beautiful, you might experience amazement!

meanings.definition: Something that helps to change or hide appearance in order to prevent being seen or recognized.
examples: The camouflage of some animals is so good, you can't see them even when you are looking right at them.

images.alt: Photo of a green frog in a green mossy background.
images.description: Green moss with brown flecks surrounds a frog. The frog has green, brown, and black areas. The frog blends in with the mossy background.
images.caption: Camouflage helps this frog blend into the plants around it.

meanings.definition: To be confused or unable to understand.
examples: I was baffled when the magician made the building completely disappear.

meanings.definition: To change how something looks to hide an identity.
examples: Julie was able to disguise herself so well, none of her friends realized who she was.

images.alt: Photo of a person wearing a mask and costume.
images.description: Photo of a person wearing a black, white, and red hat and cape. Black gloves with fingernails cover the person's hands and arms. A white mask with red lips and eye holes outlined in black completely cover the person's face.
images.caption: A mask and costume completely disguise the wearer's identity.

examples: Bears hibernate in their dens during cold winter months.

images.alt: Photo of a wolf near a hole under a log.
images.description: A wolf lays on the ground, only its head visible, surrounded by dirt, logs, and grass. A log is behind the wolf. Beneath the log is a hole, the wolf's home, or den.
images.caption: A wolf rests in front of its well-hidden den.

source.title: Wolf rests in front of the wolfs lair
source.author: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

examples: Sticking his hand into a hole, Brian recoiled in horror when he felt the body of a snake asleep in its lair.

images.alt: Photo of a wolf near a hole under a log.
images.description: A wolf lays on the ground, only its head visible, surrounded by dirt, logs, and grass. A log is behind the wolf. Beneath the log is a hole, the wolf's home, or den.
images.caption: A wolf rests in front of its well-hidden den.

source.title: Wolf rests in front of the wolfs lair
source.author: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service

examples: My cat is a friendly creature.

images.alt: Photo of bird sitting on vine branches.
images.description: A bird with feathers of different shades of green sits on a branch. In the background are plant leaves in verying shades of green. The color of leaves and the bird make them blend together.
images.caption: The bird in this picture is a beautiful creature that blends in with the plants that surround it.

examples: Every organism starts from a parent organism of the same kind.

images.alt: Photo of bird sitting on vine branches.
images.description: A bird with feathers of different shades of green sits on a branch. In the background are plant leaves in verying shades of green. The color of leaves and the bird make them blend together.
images.caption: The bird in this picture is a beautiful creature that blends in with the plants that surround it.

meanings.definition: The action of hiding something or preventing it from being known.
examples: The police insisted on concealment of facts because leaking of information could tip off the suspect.

images.alt: Photo of book with some pages replaced with radio parts.
images.description: A book is opened, and on the left side can be seen regular pages of text, while on the right side, parts of several pages have been cut out to form a hole. Stuffed inside the hole is a battery, wires, and other electronic parts that make up a radio. When closed, the radio parts would not be visible at all.
images.caption: During World War II, radios were often concealed inside books with pages removed.

meanings.definition: Unknown; not able to be understood or explained.
examples: No one touched the light switch, so the light flashing on and off by itself was mysterious.
When she fell and heard a loud snap, Leah instantly knew that she had broken her arm.
Because the weather was clear and sunny a few moments ago, the sudden thunderstorm is inexplicable.
Knowing that her friend lied to her instantaneously changed her feelings for her friend.
